description: Indicates the Up alarm of the mac-tunnel.
This object forms a pair with the following hwMinMMacTnlDown.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlUp HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlOperStatus i 1

description: Indicates the name of the mac-tunnel.
It is a character string with a maximum of 31 bytes and a minimum of 1 byte.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName

description: Indicates the remote MAC address of the current mac-tunnel.
By default, there is no such configuration.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac

description: Indicates BVLAN value of the current BVLAN used by the mac-tunnel: It ranges from 1 to 4094. By default, BVLAN value is not configured.
The VLAN here must have been created and be in the backbone VLAN used by the mac-tunnel.
The special value of zero is used to indicate that no VLAN-ID is present or used.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID

description: Indicates the administration status of the mac-tunnel.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlAdminStatus

description: Indicates the physical state of the mac-tunnel.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlOperStatus

description: Indicates the Down alarm of the mac-tunnel.
This object forms a pair with the previous hwMinMMacTnlUp.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDown HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlOperStatus i 1

description: Indicates the Up alarm of a service instance.
This object forms a pair with the following hwMinMSIDown.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIUp HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIID i 9999 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIOperStatus i 1

description: Indicates the ID of a service instance. It can be any value within 24 bits.
By default, the value is null.
One ID can be configured to one service instance only.

description: Indicates an alarm on the connectivity of fault.

Summary.eval: ($v4 == 1) ? 'Connectivity fault alarm occurred' : 'Connectivity fault alarm cleared'

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlCCFaultAlarm HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRMepCcmDefect i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRdiDefect i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlCCFaultAlarm HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRMepCcmDefect i 2 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRdiDefect i 1

description: Indicates the name of the mac-tunnel.
It is a character string with a maximum of 31 bytes and a minimum of 1 byte.

description: Indicates the remote MAC address of the current mac-tunnel.
By default, there is no such configuration.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac

description: Indicates BVLAN value of the current BVLAN used by the mac-tunnel: It ranges from 1 to 4094. By default, BVLAN value is not configured.
The VLAN here must have been created and be in the backbone VLAN used by the mac-tunnel.
The special value of zero is used to indicate that no VLAN-ID is present or used.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID

description: Indicates a connectivity failure of tunnels.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRMepCcmDefect

description: Indicates whether the RDI packet from the remote end is received.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSomeRdiDefect

description: Indicates the Aps protection group switchover alarm of the mac-tunnel.
This object forms a pair with the following hwMinMMacTnlRevertive.
hwMinMMacTnlName: indicates the name of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMMacTnlDMac: indicates the destination MAC address of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID: indicates the BVLANID of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlName: Indicates the name of the backup tunnel.
hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation: Indicates the switchover commands for the Aps protection group of mac-tunnels.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID: indicates the BVLANID of the backup tunnel.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac:indicates the destination MAC address of the backup tunnel.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSwitch HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSwitch HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlSwitch HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 5

description: Indicates the name of the mac-tunnel.
It is a character string with a maximum of 31 bytes and a minimum of 1 byte.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName

description: Indicates the remote MAC address of the current mac-tunnel.
By default, there is no such configuration.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac

description: Indicates BVLAN value of the current BVLAN used by the mac-tunnel: It ranges from 1 to 4094. By default, BVLAN value is not configured.
The VLAN here must have been created and be in the backbone VLAN used by the mac-tunnel.
The special value of zero is used to indicate that no VLAN-ID is present or used.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID

description: Indicates the tunnel name of the protective mac-tunnel.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName

description: Indicates the remote MAC address of the protecting mac-tunnel.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac

description: Indicates BVLAN value used by the protecting mac-tunnel: It ranges from 1 to 4094.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID

description: Indicates the switchover commands for the Aps protection group of mac-tunnels.
The priority levels in a descending order are: clear, lock, force and manual.
clear(1): clears the lock, force and manual commands, and WTR state on the local end.
After the local commands are cleared, the WTR state cannot be entered.
lock(2): locks the services on the working tunnel.
force(3): forcibly switches the services to the protection tunnel when the protection tunnel is in sound state.
manual(4): forcibly switches the services to the protection channel when the working and the protection tunnel are in sound state.
null(5):there is not manual commands.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation

description: Indicates the Aps protection group switchover alarm of the mac-tunnel.
This object forms a pair with the previous hwMinMMacTnlSwitch.
hwMinMMacTnlName: indicates the name of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMMacTnlDMac: indicates the destination MAC address of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID: indicates the BVLANID of the primary tunnel.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlName: Indicates the name of the backup tunnel.
hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation: Indicates the switchover commands for the Aps protection group of mac-tunnels.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID: indicates the BVLANID of the backup tunnel.
hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac:indicates the destination MAC address of the backup tunnel.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlRevertive HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlRevertive HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlRevertive HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMMacTnlBVlanID i 0 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlDMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectMacTnlBVlanID i 1 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMProtectSwitchOperation i 5

By default, there is no such configuration.

The VLAN here must have been created and be in the backbone VLAN used by the mac-tunnel.
The special value of zero is used to indicate that no VLAN-ID is present or used.

description: Indicates the switchover commands for the Aps protection group of mac-tunnels.
The priority levels in a descending order are: clear, lock, force and manual.
clear(1): clears the lock, force and manual commands, and WTR state on the local end.
After the local commands are cleared, the WTR state cannot be entered.
lock(2): locks the services on the working tunnel.
force(3): forcibly switches the services to the protection tunnel when the protection tunnel is in sound state.
manual(4): forcibly switches the services to the protection channel when the working and the protection tunnel are in sound state.

description: Indicates the alarm of the mac limiting number beyond the Threshold.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIMacLimitNumRaisingThreshold HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIID i 9999 HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIMacLimitMaxinum i 9999

description: Indicates the name of a service instance.
It is a character string with a maximum of 31 bytes and a minimum of 1 byte.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIName

description: Indicates the ID of a service instance. It can be any value within 24 bits.
By default, the value is null.
One ID can be configured to one service instance only.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIID

description: Indicates MAC learning restriction of a service instance.
The number of MAC addresses that can be learnt by the current service instance ranges from 0 to 131072.
When the number is set to zero, no restriction is imposed on the address learning.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MINM-MIB::hwMinMSIMacLimitMaxinum
